results.name: Number of even entries (A048967) minus the number of odd entries (A001316) in row n of Pascal's triangle (A007318).
formula: a(n) = sum(k=0, n, (-1)^C(n, k) ); a(2^n) = 2^n-3; a(2^n+1)=2^n-6; more generally there's a sequence z(k) such that for any k>=0 and for 2^n >k, a(2^n+k) = 2^n+z(k); for k=0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8... z(k) = -3, -6, -5, -12, -3, -10, -9, -24, 1, ... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 18 2002
a(2n) = a(n) + n, a(2n+1) = 2a(n). - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 05 2004
a(n)=-sum{k=0..n, mu(binomial(n, k) mod 2)}; - _Paul Barry_, Apr 29 2005
